site_name: Mississippi Therapy Canines DBA Mississippi Therapy Animals - Katrinna Miller

citations.narrative:
Conversation with the licensee and review of their social media page show exhibition of a spider monkey without approval
for Group 6 non-human primates on their license. Also the licensee obtained a serval cat approximately 7 weeks ago and
failed to notify Animal Care about the addition of this new type of animal not approved on their current license. The USDA
license authorizes specific number and types of animals to ensure that the facility and personnel possess adequate
facilities, employees and education to provide sufficient husbandry to the regulated animals. A licensee must obtain a new
expanded license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number or types of animals on hand at any
single point in time during the period of licensure. The licensee may reapply for a license that properly reflects the number
and types of regulated animals under the license before exhibiting or conducting regulated activities with these animals.
Correct by December 30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
DIANA CARE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
